text: , also romanized as Tempuku, was a after Jōei and before Bunryaku. This period started in April 1233 and ended in November 1234.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tempuku" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 957. The reigning emperor was .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du Japon, pp. 242-243; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 227. ==Events of the Tenpuku Era== * 1233 (Tenpuku 1, 1st month): Kujō Yoritsune is granted the court post of Titsingh, p. 242. ==Related pages == * Kamakura period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Tenpuku 1st 2nd 1233 1234 Preceded by: Jōei Era or nengō: Tenpuku Succeeded by: Bunryaku Category:Japanese eras Category:1233 Category:1234 Category:1230s in Japan
title: Tenpuku
